page.title: 12Bredwardine; Religion.
page.content: The Church of England is the only religious body having places of worship in the area. Members of other denominations have to travel some distance to attend services. There are two churches, St. Andrew's in Bredwardine and St. Michael and All Angels at Moccas, both dating back to about the 12th Century. The present Rector, Rev. W. King, has charge of both and also the churches at Hardwicke and Cusop. A joint Parish Magazine, 'The Link', is produced and this is also an important village news-sheet since it contains items of information of local interest as well as church matters.
